medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulties with dark adaptation and severe visual acuity loss in the right eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in June 1997 with difficulties in dark adaptation, visual acuity measured at 20/30 in the right eye. In October 2000, the patient reported worsening nyctalopia; visual acuity fluctuated from 20/40 to 20/80 in the right eye from November 2000 to March 2001, culminating in a rapid decline to 20/400 by early April 2001, accompanied by a central scotoma. The patient's symptoms remained stable over 2 years of follow-up, with the left eye remaining stable at 20/30.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for retinal degeneration in her deceased father and choroideremia in 3 male paternal first cousins.
medical_history.family_history: Retinal degeneration in her deceased father and choroideremia in 3 paternal male first cousins.
